data.title: Travels of the President
data.text: William Pierce Rogers Kabul Met with King Mohammad Zahir Shah and Prime Minister Etemadi. May 25, 1969 Henry A. (Heinz Alfred) Kissinger Kabul Official visit. Met with Prime Minister Daoud and senior Afghan officials. November 1, 1974 Henry A. (Heinz Alfred) Kissinger Kabul Official visit. Met with Prime Minister Daoud and senior Afghan officials. August 8, 1976 Colin Luther Powell Kabul Met with leaders of the Afghan Interim Authority. Announced the upgrading of the U.S. Liaison Office to Embassy status. January 17, 2002 Colin Luther Powell Kabul Met with President Karzai and with U.S. military and civilian officials. March 17, 2004 Condoleezza Rice Kabul Met with President Karzai and Afghan political leaders; addressed U.S. military personnel. March 17, 2005 Condoleezza Rice Kabul Met with President Karzai. October 12, 2005 Condoleezza Rice Bagram, Kabul Accompanied President Bush. March 1, 2006 Condoleezza Rice Kabul Met with President Karzai. June 28, 2006 Condoleezza Rice Kandahar, Kabul Accompanied British Foreign Secretary Miliband. Met with President Karzai. February 7, 2008 Hillary Rodham Clinton Kabul Attended the inauguration of President Karzai. November 18–19, 2009 Hillary Rodham Clinton Kabul Met with President Karzai and attended an international conference on the future of Afghanistan. July 19–20, 2010 Hillary Rodham Clinton Kabul Met with President Karzai and Afghan civil leaders. October 20, 2011 Hillary Rodham Clinton Kabul Met with President Hamid Karzai. Announced the designation of Afghanistan as a Major Non-NATO Ally. July 7, 2012 John Forbes Kerry Kabul Met with President Hamid Karzai. March 25–26, 2013 John Forbes Kerry Kabul Met with President Hamid Karzai. Signed Bilateral Security Agreement. October 11–12, 2013 John Forbes Kerry Kabul Met with President Hamid Karzai, Afghan political leaders, and the head of the UN Assistance Mission. July 11–12, 2014 John Forbes Kerry Kabul Met with President Hamid Karzai and presidential candidates Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani. August 7–8, 2014 John Forbes Kerry Kabul Attended the third meeting of the U.S.-Afghanistan Bilateral Commission. April 9, 2016 Rex W. Tillerson Bagram Met with President Ashraf Ghani. October 23, 2017 Michael R. Pompeo Kabul Met with Afghan officials. July 9, 2018 Michael R. Pompeo Kabul Met with President Ashraf Ghani, Chief Executive Abdullah Abdullah, former President Hamid Karzai, and others to discuss next steps in the Afghan Peace Process. June 25, 2019
